results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-59fbff7b59-d22cx Pod/wordpress-59fbff7b59-qm55j Pod/wordpress-59fbff7b59-5b697], expected 3

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected 3 pods are not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs <pod-name>`.
3. Verify readiness probes in pod spec.
4. Ensure network policies allow traffic.
5. Restart pods if needed.

results.name: default/mysql-7c986569f6-hnzx7

error.Text: Liveness probe failed: dial tcp 10.244.2.7:3306: connect: connection refused

results.details:
Error: The liveness probe failed because the application couldn't connect to the service at IP 10.244.2.7 on port 3306.

Solution: 
1. Verify the service is running on 10.244.2.7:3306.
2. Check network policies/firewalls.
3. Ensure the pod has the correct permissions.
4. Restart the pod to reset the connection.

results.name: default/mysql-7c986569f6-jhgcz

error.Text:
Readiness probe failed: mysqladmin: connect to server at 'localhost' failed
error: 'Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)'
Check that mysqld is running and that the socket: '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' exists!

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes readiness probe failed because it can't connect to the MySQL server via the specified socket.

Solution: 
1. Ensure MySQL is running: `systemctl status mysql`.
2. Verify the socket file exists: `ls /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock`.
3. Restart MySQL: `systemctl restart mysql`.

results.name: default/wordpress-59fbff7b59-5b697

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.
